Class ErrorResponseException

              • io.sphere.sdk.client.ClientErrorException
                • io.sphere.sdk.client.BadRequestException
                  • io.sphere.sdk.client.ErrorResponseException
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ErrorResponse, java.io.Serializable

    public class ErrorResponseException
extends BadRequestException
implements ErrorResponse

    Error Codes

    InvalidField

    One possible cause could be, that you try to set the value of a product attribute and the type is not matching or you have an enum field and the key is wrong.

    Example: {"statusCode":400,"message":"The value '2' is not valid for field 'fieldNameExample'. Allowed values are: \"red\",\"green\". ","errors":[{"code":"InvalidField","message":"The value '2' is not valid for field 'fieldNameExample'. Allowed values are: \"red\",\"green\". ","invalidValue":2,"allowedValues":["red","green"],"field":"fieldNameExample"}]}
    See Also:
